snippet: The 500 new apartments are in neighborhoods, in territory Israel captured during the 1967 war and later annexed, that are considered illegal settlements by most of the world.
abstract: Jerusalem city committee gives final approval for more than 500 new apartments in Jewish neighborhoods of East Jerusalem, routine bureaucratic step that nonetheless could cause ripples in American efforts to broker a peace agreement between Israel and the Palestinians; neighborhoods, in territory Israel captured during the 1967 war and later annexed, are considered illegal settlements by most of the world.
lead_paragraph: The 500 new apartments are in neighborhoods, in territory Israel captured during the 1967 war and later annexed, that are considered illegal settlements by most of the world.

headline.main: Israel: Final Approval Is Given on East Jerusalem Apartments
headline.print_headline: Israel: Final Approval Is Given on East Jerusalem Apartments
